page.title: 02LANDSCAPE.
page.content: The survey area for Low Port Primary School is a mixture of farmland and thickly wooded places. The country-side is undulating and ranges from 188 to 254 feet above sea level.Several small streams run through this area and they feed into the old reservoir, which is now a water sports centre. There are some interesting things to be seen. One of these is an ancient hill fort, known locally as Peace Hill,it has not been excavated but is quite clearly marked on the map. Another interesting thing we found out was that there are several small volcanic plugs to be found in some of the fields. Some of these are small enough for the local farmers to remove with modern, heavy lifting equipment. One was removed from Riccarton farm to level out a field corner.
